Class Database

java.lang.Object
project.Database
public class Database extends Object
Manages the database, including its catalog of tables, loaded tables in memory, and tracking unsaved changes.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Database()
    Constructs a new Database instance, initializing internal structures.

  • Constructor Details

    • Database

      public Database()
      Constructs a new Database instance, initializing internal structures.

  • Method Details

    • isCatalogOpen

      public boolean isCatalogOpen()
      Checks if a database catalog file is currently open.
      Returns:
      True if a catalog is open, false otherwise.

    • getCurrentCatalogFilePath

      public String getCurrentCatalogFilePath()
      Gets the file path of the currently open database catalog.
      Returns:
      The file path, or null if no catalog is open.

    • hasUnsavedChanges

      public boolean hasUnsavedChanges()
      Checks if there are any unsaved changes in the database (either to table data or catalog structure).
      Returns:
      True if there are unsaved changes, false otherwise.

    • loadCatalog

      public void loadCatalog(String filePath, Map<String,String> registry) throws DatabaseOperationException
      Loads a database catalog from the specified file path and its associated tables into memory. If a catalog is already open, it will be closed first (without saving changes). It reads the catalog file to get the registry of table names and their corresponding data file paths. Then, for each entry, it attempts to load the table data from its file.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the database catalog file.
      registry - A map containing table names as keys and their file paths as values, typically read from the catalog file.
      Throws:
      DatabaseOperationException - If any error occurs during catalog loading or table loading.

    • closeCatalog

      public void closeCatalog()
      Closes the currently open database catalog. This clears all loaded tables from memory and resets the unsaved changes flag. It does not automatically save changes, that must be done explicitly before closing if desired.

    • markCatalogAsSaved

      public void markCatalogAsSaved(String filePath)
      Marks the current catalog as saved to the specified file path. This typically occurs after a 'save' or 'saveas' operation.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path where the catalog was saved.

    • getTable

      public Table getTable(String name) throws DatabaseOperationException
      Retrieves a table by its name from the in-memory store.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the table to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The Table object.
      Throws:
      DatabaseOperationException - If no catalog is open, or if the table is not found or not loaded.

    • registerNewTable

      public void registerNewTable(Table table, String filePath) throws DatabaseOperationException
      Registers a newly created table in the database. The table is added to the in-memory store and its path to the file registry. Marks the database as having unsaved changes.
      Parameters:
      table - The Table object to register.
      filePath - The file path where this table will be/is saved.
      Throws:
      DatabaseOperationException - If no catalog is open, the table name is invalid, or the table name already exists.

    • registerImportedTable

      public void registerImportedTable(Table table, String filePath) throws DatabaseOperationException
      Registers an imported table into the database. Similar to registerNewTable(Table, String), but typically used for tables read from external files not initially part of the catalog. Marks the database as having unsaved changes.
      Parameters:
      table - The imported Table object.
      filePath - The file path from which this table was imported.
      Throws:
      DatabaseOperationException - If no catalog is open, the table name is invalid, or the table name already exists.

    • dataModified

      public void dataModified(String tableName) throws DatabaseOperationException
      Marks that data within a specific table has been modified. This sets the global unsaved changes flag for the database.
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the table that was modified.
      Throws:
      DatabaseOperationException - If no catalog is open or if the table is not known/loaded.

    • removeTableRegistration

      public void removeTableRegistration(String name) throws DatabaseOperationException
      Removes a table's registration from the database. This removes the table from the in-memory store and the file path registry. It does not delete the table's data file from disk. Marks the database as having unsaved changes.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the table to remove.
      Throws:
      DatabaseOperationException - If no catalog is open or if the table is not found.

    • renameTableRegistration

      public void renameTableRegistration(String oldName, String newName, String newFilePath) throws DatabaseOperationException
      Renames a table in the database, updating its registration and in-memory representation. This includes changing the table's name in the file path registry and updating the Table object's name. Marks the database as having unsaved changes.
      Parameters:
      oldName - The current name of the table.
      newName - The new name for the table.
      newFilePath - The new file path for the table's data file (often derived from newName).
      Throws:
      DatabaseOperationException - If no catalog is open, names are invalid, old name not found, or new name already exists.

    • getTableRegistry

      public Map<String,String> getTableRegistry()
      Gets an unmodifiable view of the table file path registry.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable map of table names to their file paths.

    • getAllTablesInMemory

      public Map<String,Table> getAllTablesInMemory()
      Gets an unmodifiable view of all tables currently loaded in memory.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable map of table names to Table objects.

    • getTableNames

      public Set<String> getTableNames()
      Gets an unmodifiable set of the names of all tables registered in the catalog.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable set of table names.

    • getTableFilePath

      public String getTableFilePath(String tableName) throws DatabaseOperationException
      Gets the file path associated with a given table name from the registry.
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the table.
      Returns:
      The file path for the table's data.
      Throws:
      DatabaseOperationException - If the table name is not found in the registry.

    • getModifiedLoadedTableNames

      public Set<String> getModifiedLoadedTableNames()
      Gets a set of names for all tables currently loaded in memory that are considered modified If hasUnsavedChangesGlobal is true, it returns all loaded table names.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable set of names of loaded tables if unsaved changes exist, otherwise an empty set.

    • getLoadedTable

      public Table getLoadedTable(String name)
      Retrieves a table directly from the in-memory map without throwing an exception if not found (returns null instead). Used internally.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the table.
      Returns:
      The Table object, or null if not found in memory.
